summary: This is an email from defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to the court and other attorneys in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, stating that after conferring, the parties have agreed that redactions to the Bail Reply Memorandum are unnecessary and that the original document has been publicly filed.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, sending an email to the court and other counsel regarding the filing of the Bail Reply Memorandum without redactions.

events.title: Filing of Bail Reply Memorandum
events.description: The parties in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell confer and agree that no redactions are needed for the Bail Reply Memorandum, which is then publicly filed.

locations: 33 West 19th Street - 4th Floor, New York, NY 10011
keyFacts: The defense and prosecution in the Ghislaine Maxwell case agreed that no redactions were necessary for the Bail Reply Memorandum.
The agreed-upon, unredacted Bail Reply Memorandum was publicly filed on March 23, 2021.
The email confirms ongoing legal proceedings and coordination between the defense team and the court during the COVID-19 pandemic.
